concept.title: Singly linked lists
concept.shortdesc: A singly linked list is one where each element points forwards to the next element.

conbody.p: Unlike a doubly linked list, elements do not point back to the previous element. The list has an anchor point which points forwards to the first element and also has a pointer to the last element.
Anchor points are always referred to as headers.
A singly linked list is useful for maintaining a non-circular queue of items; for example, a stack.
Singly linked lists involve the creation and use of the classes:
In practice, these classes are almost always used as components of other classes.
